alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:21PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northwestern Sussex, southwestern New Castle, Kent, northeastern Talbot, eastern Queen Anne`s, Caroline, northeastern Kent and southwestern Cumberland Counties through 300 PM EST... At 220 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from Sassafras to near Copperville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dover, Easton, Georgetown, Centerville, Smyrna, Milford, Seaford, Denton, Centreville, Harrington, Camden, Clayton, Federalsburg, Bridgeville, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Cheswold, Church Hill and Preston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
